memberdef.name: calculatePartialOfPointMassGravityWrtPositionOfAcceleratedBody

briefdescription.para: Calculates partial derivative of point mass gravitational acceleration wrt the position of body undergoing acceleration.

detaileddescription.para:
Calculates partial derivative of point mass gravitational acceleration wrt the position of body undergoing acceleration.
acceleratedBodyPosition
Cartesian state of body being accelerated.
acceleratingBodyPosition
Cartesian state of body exerting acceleration.
gravitationalParameter
Gravitational parameter of gravitating body.
Matrix with the Jacobian of the acceleration vector w.r.t. the position vector.

memberdef.name: computeDirectTidalAccelerationDueToTideOnPlanetWrtPosition

briefdescription.para: Function to compute partial derivative of direct tidal acceleration due to tide on planet w.r.t. position of satellite.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to compute partial derivative of direct tidal acceleration due to tide on planet w.r.t. position of satellite (equal to -1 * partial w.r.t. position of planet)
relativeStateOfBodyExertingTide
State of satellite w.r.t. host planet.
planetAngularVelocityVector
Angular velocity vector ogf host planet
currentTidalAccelerationMultiplier
Scalar multiplier that is common to all vector terms (term outside of brackets in Eq. (3) of Lainey et al. (2007)).
timeLag
Time lag of tidal bulge
includeDirectRadialComponent
True if term independent of time lag is to be included, false otherwise
Partial derivative of direct tidal acceleration due to tide on planet w.r.t. position of satellite

memberdef.argsstring: (const Eigen::Vector6d relativeStateOfBodyExertingTide, const double currentTidalAccelerationMultiplier, const double timeLag)

memberdef.argsstring: (const Eigen::Vector6d &cartesianElements, const double gravitationalParameter, const Eigen::Vector6d &cartesianStateElementPerturbations)
memberdef.name: calculateNumericalPartialOfTrueAnomalyWrtState

briefdescription.para: Function determine the numerical partial derivative of the true anomaly wrt the elements of the Cartesian state.

detaileddescription.para:
unction determine the numerical partial derivative of the true anomaly wrt the elements of the Cartesian state, from the Cartesian state as input. A first-order central difference with a user-defined Cartesian state perturbation vector is used.
cartesianElements
Nominal Cartesian elements at which the partials are to be computed
gravitationalParameter
Gravitational parameter of central body around which Keplerian orbit is given
cartesianStateElementPerturbations
Numerical perturbations of Cartesian state that are to be used
Partial of Cartesian state wrt true anomaly of orbit.

briefdescription.para: Dummy function used for update, performs no calculations.

detaileddescription.para: Dummy function used for update, performs no calculations.

memberdef.argsstring: (const double time)
memberdef.name: emptyTimeFunction

briefdescription.para: Dummy function used for update, performs no calculations.

detaileddescription.para:
Dummy function used for update, performs no calculations.
time
Input parameter, not used by function.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::function< void(Eigen::Vector6d) > setBodyState, std::shared_ptr< basic_astrodynamics::AccelerationModel< Eigen::Vector3d > > accelerationModel, Eigen::Vector6d originalState, Eigen::Vector3d statePerturbation, int startIndex, std::function< void() > updateFunction=emptyFunction, const double evaluationTime=TUDAT_NAN)
memberdef.name: calculateAccelerationWrtStatePartials

briefdescription.para: Function to numerical compute the partial derivative of an acceleration w.r.t. a body state.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to numerical compute the partial derivative of an acceleration w.r.t. a body state (position or velocity), using a first-order central difference method.
setBodyState
Function to reset the current state w.r.t. which the partial is to be computed.
accelerationModel
Acceleration model for which the partial derivative is to be computed.
originalState
Nominal state at which the partial derivative is to be computed.
statePerturbation
Perturbation to the position or velocity that is to be used
startIndex
Start index in the state vector from where the statePerturbation is to be added (i.e. 0 if function is to compute partial w.r.t. position, 3 if w.r.t velocity).
updateFunction
Function to update the required environment models following the change of the body state.
evaluationTime
Time at which partial is to be evaluated (default NaN).
Numerical partial of the acceleration w.r.t. position or velocity (depending on function input).

memberdef.argsstring: (std::function< void(Eigen::Vector7d) > setBodyRotationalState, std::shared_ptr< basic_astrodynamics::TorqueModel > torqueModel, Eigen::Vector7d originalRotationalState, Eigen::VectorXd statePerturbations, int startIndex, int numberOfEntries, std::function< void() > updateFunction=emptyFunction, const double evaluationTime=TUDAT_NAN)
memberdef.name: calculateTorqueWrtRotationalStatePartials

briefdescription.para: Function to numerical compute the partial derivative of a torque w.r.t. a body rotational state.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to numerical compute the partial derivative of an torque w.r.t. a body rotational state elements using a first-order central difference method.
setBodyRotationalState
Function to reset the current rotational state w.r.t. which the partial is to be computed.
torqueModel
Torque model for which the partial derivative is to be computed.
originalRotationalState
Nominal rotational state at which the partial derivative is to be computed.
statePerturbations
Perturbation to the states that is to be used
startIndex
Start index in the state vector from where the statePerturbation is to be added (i.e. 0 if function is to compute partial w.r.t. quaternion, 4 if w.r.t angular velocity).
numberOfEntries
Integer denoting the number of entries.
updateFunction
Function to update the required environment models following the change of the body state.
evaluationTime
Time at which partial is to be evaluated (default NaN).
Numerical partial of the torque w.r.t. body rotational state elements

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::function< void(Eigen::Vector7d) > setBodyRotationalState, std::shared_ptr< basic_astrodynamics::AccelerationModel< Eigen::Vector3d > > accelerationModel, const Eigen::Vector7d &originalRotationalState, const Eigen::Vector4d &commandedQuaternionPerturbation, std::vector< Eigen::Vector4d > &appliedQuaternionPerturbation, std::function< void() > updateFunction=emptyFunction, const double evaluationTime=TUDAT_NAN)
memberdef.name: calculateAccelerationDeviationDueToOrientationChange

briefdescription.para: Function to numerical compute the partial derivative of a acceleration w.r.t. a body rotational quaternion.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to numerical compute the partial derivative of an acceleration w.r.t. a body rotational quaternion elements using a first-order central difference method.
setBodyRotationalState
Function to reset the current rotational state w.r.t. which the partial is to be computed.
accelerationModel
Acceleration model for which the partial derivative is to be computed.
originalRotationalState
Nominal rotational state at which the partial derivative is to be computed.
commandedQuaternionPerturbation
Perturbation to the quaternion that is to be used
appliedQuaternionPerturbation
Quaternion perturbations that were actually applied (after manifold correction)
updateFunction
Function to update the required environment models following the change of the body state.
evaluationTime
Time at which partial is to be evaluated (default NaN).
Numerical partial of the acceleration w.r.t. body rotational quaternion elements

memberdef.name: calculateAccelerationWrtParameterPartials

briefdescription.para: Function to numerical compute the partial derivative of an acceleration w.r.t. a double parameter.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to numerical compute the partial derivative of an acceleration w.r.t. a double parameter, using a first-order central difference method.
parameter
Object describing the parameter w.r.t. which the partial is to be taken.
accelerationModel
Acceleration model for which the partial derivative is to be computed.
parameterPerturbation
Perturbation to be used for parameter value.
updateDependentVariables
Function to update the required environment models following the change in parameter, for models that do not explicitly depend on the current time.
currentTime
Time at which partial is to be computed.
timeDependentUpdateDependentVariables
Function to update the required environment models following the change in parameters for models that do explicitly depend on the current time.
Numerical partial of the acceleration w.r.t. given parameter.

memberdef.argsstring: (const double distance, const double radiusPowerTerm, const double cosineOfOrderLongitude, const double sineOfOrderLongitude, const double cosineOfLatitude, const double sineOfLatitude, const double preMultiplier, const int degree, const int order, const double cosineHarmonicCoefficient, const double sineHarmonicCoefficient, const double legendrePolynomial, const double legendrePolynomialDerivative, const double legendrePolynomialSecondDerivative, Eigen::Matrix3d &sphericalHessian)
memberdef.name: computePotentialSphericalHessian

briefdescription.para: Function to compute the spherical Hessian of a single term of a spherical harmonic potential.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to compute the spherical Hessian (i.e. matrix of second derivatives w.r.t. spherical components radius, latitude and longitude) of a single term of a spherical harmonic potential.
distance
Distance to center of body with gravity field at which the partials are to be calculated
radiusPowerTerm
Distance divided by the reference radius of the gravity field, to the power (degree + 1)
cosineOfOrderLongitude
Cosine of order times the longitude at which the potential is to be calculated
sineOfOrderLongitude
Sine of order times the longitude at which the potential is to be calculated
cosineOfLatitude
Cosine of the latitude at which the potential is to be calculated
sineOfLatitude
Sine of the latitude at which the potential is to be calculated
preMultiplier
Pre-multiplier of potential (gravitational parametere divided by reference radius in normal representation)
degree
Degree of the harmonic for which the gradient is to be computed.
order
Order of the harmonic for which the gradient is to be computed.
cosineHarmonicCoefficient
Coefficient which characterizes relative strengh of a harmonic term.
sineHarmonicCoefficient
Coefficient which characterizes relative strengh of a harmonic term.
legendrePolynomial
Value of associated Legendre polynomial with the same degree and order as the to be computed harmonic, and with the sine of the latitude coordinate as polynomial parameter.
legendrePolynomialDerivative
Value of the derivative of parameter 'legendrePolynomial' with respect to the sine of the latitude angle.
legendrePolynomialSecondDerivative
Value of second derivative of parameter 'legendrePolynomial' with respect to the sine of the latitude angle.
sphericalHessian
Hessian of potential term in spherical coordinates (returned by reference).

memberdef.argsstring: (const Eigen::Vector3d &sphericalPosition, const double referenceRadius, const double preMultiplier, const int degree, const int order, const double cosineHarmonicCoefficient, const double sineHarmonicCoefficient, const double legendrePolynomial, const double legendrePolynomialDerivative, const double legendrePolynomialSecondDerivative, Eigen::Matrix3d &sphericalHessian)
memberdef.name: computePotentialSphericalHessian

briefdescription.para: Function to compute the spherical Hessian of a single term of a spherical harmonic potential.

detaileddescription.para:
Function to compute the spherical Hessian (i.e. matrix of second derivatives w.r.t. spherical components radius, latitude and longitude) of a single term of a spherical harmonic potential.
sphericalPosition
Spherical position (radius, ,latitude, longitude) at which potential partials are to be evaluated
referenceRadius
Reference radius of spherical harmonic potential.
preMultiplier
Pre-multiplier of potential (gravitational parametere divided by reference radius in normal representation)
degree
Degree of the harmonic for which the gradient is to be computed.
order
Order of the harmonic for which the gradient is to be computed.
cosineHarmonicCoefficient
Coefficient which characterizes relative strengh of a harmonic term.
sineHarmonicCoefficient
Coefficient which characterizes relative strengh of a harmonic term.
legendrePolynomial
Value of associated Legendre polynomial with the same degree and order as the to be computed harmonic, and with the sine of the latitude coordinate as polynomial parameter.
legendrePolynomialDerivative
Value of the derivative of parameter 'legendrePolynomial' with respect to the sine of the latitude angle.
legendrePolynomialSecondDerivative
Value of second derivative of parameter 'legendrePolynomial' with respect to the sine of the latitude angle.
sphericalHessian
Hessian of potential term in spherical coordinates (returned by reference).

memberdef.argsstring: (const Eigen::Vector3d &sphericalPosition, const double preMultiplier, const int degree, const int order, const double cosineHarmonicCoefficient, const double sineHarmonicCoefficient, const std::shared_ptr< basic_mathematics::SphericalHarmonicsCache > sphericalHarmonicsCache, Eigen::Matrix3d &sphericalHessian)
memberdef.name: computePotentialSphericalHessian

briefdescription.para: Function to compute the spherical Hessian of a single term of a spherical harmonic potential.

detaileddescription.para:

sphericalPosition

order

cosineHarmonicCoefficient

sineHarmonicCoefficient
Coefficient which characterizes relative strengh of a harmonic term.
sphericalHarmonicsCache

sphericalHessian
Hessian of potential term in spherical coordinates (returned by reference).

Spherical position (radius, ,latitude, longitude) at which potential partials are to be evaluated
referenceRadius
Reference radius of spherical harmonic potential.
gravitionalParameter
Gravitational parameter used for spherical harmonic expansion
cosineHarmonicCoefficients
Matrix of coefficient which characterize the relative strengh of cosine harmonic terms.
sineHarmonicCoefficients
Matrix of coefficient which characterize the relative strengh of sine harmonic terms.
sphericalHarmonicsCache
Cache object containing precomputed spherical harmonics terms.
Hessian of potential in spherical coordinates (returned by reference).

memberdef.name: calculateSphericalHarmonicGravityWrtCCoefficients

briefdescription.para: Calculate partial of spherical harmonic acceleration w.r.t. a set of cosine coefficients.

detaileddescription.para:
Calculate partial of spherical harmonic acceleration w.r.t. a set of cosine coefficients
sphericalPosition
Spherical coordinate of body undergoing acceleration in frame fixed to body exerting acceleration, as radius, latitude, longitude.
referenceRadius
Reference radius of spherical harmonic potential.
gravitionalParameter
Gravitational parameter used for spherical harmonic expansion
sphericalHarmonicsCache
Cache object containing precomputed spherical harmonics terms.
blockIndices
List of cosine coefficient indices wrt which the partials are to be taken (first and second are degree and order for each vector entry).
sphericalToCartesianGradientMatrix
Matrix to convert (by premultiplication) a spherical gradient to a Cartesian gradient
bodyFixedToIntegrationFrame
Matrix to rotate from body-fixed to integration frame.
partialsMatrix
Partials of spherical harmonic acceleration w.r.t. to requested set of cosine coefficients (returned by reference).
maximumAccelerationDegree
Maximum degree of acceleration for which partial is to be computed
maximumAccelerationOrder
Maximum degree of acceleration for which partial is to be computed
